sense.name: cord
sense.commentary: a metal conductor that carries electricity and is used to bring electricity to appliances
sense.examples: A 12 gauge electric wire was used to power the robot. I couldn't figure out which wire to unplug. When she tripped over the wire the room went black.

sense.name: telegram/newswire/money transactions
sense.commentary: a message transmitted by telegraph (often news or money transactions or personal message)
sense.examples: The small newspaper relied heavily upon a wire service for stories. The intern spent most of the day sorting through the news wire items. John always calls Mary for money because her bank offers free wire transfer services. The wire said that I should come home immediately.

sense.name: fence
sense.commentary: Metal used to fasten things or make cages or fences etc
sense.examples: They realized that someone stole the cow when they saw the wires on the fence had been cut. George is an expert and climbing over barbed wire. Sally used chicken wire to keep the dog out of her snow fort.

sense.name: finishing line
sense.commentary: the finishing line on a racetrack
sense.examples: The two horses were neck and neck at the wire. The runners were so close that they had to use a camera to see who was first to cross the wire.
